title: How to Cook a Whole Chicken in the Oven

steps.title: Defrost your whole chicken
steps.content: Defrost your whole chicken . Depending upon the size of the bird, it can take between 1 and 3 days to defrost in the refrigerator. It is recommended that you cook soon after defrosting to avoid food borne illness. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Preheat your oven to 450 degrees Fahrenheit (232 degrees Celsius).
steps.content: Preheat your oven to 450 degrees Fahrenheit (232 degrees Celsius). Place a rack in the middle to low middle of the oven, depending upon the size of the whole chicken.

steps.title: Clear a space in your kitchen near the sink.
steps.content: Clear a space in your kitchen near the sink. Remove other kitchen appliances, dishes and silverware to reduce cross contamination. Ready your roasting pan or Dutch oven nearby for easy transfer.

steps.title: Remove the chicken from its packaging.
steps.content: Remove the chicken from its packaging. Place the packaging directly in the trash.

steps.title: Remove the neck and giblets from the cavity.
steps.content: Remove the neck and giblets from the cavity. [2] X Research source Throw them away if you do not want to use them for a gravy.

steps.title: Place your hand near the opening of the cavity, with the breast upward.
steps.content: Place your hand near the opening of the cavity, with the breast upward. Stick your fingers between the breast and the skin. Move your hands underneath the skin to loosen it for seasoning. The chicken cook faster and more evenly if you butterfly, or spatchcock, it first. [3] X Expert Source Ollie George Cigliano Private Chef & Food Educator Expert Interview. 30 August 2021.

steps.title: Wash your hands for 30 seconds before handling any other ingredients or dishes.
steps.content: Wash your hands for 30 seconds before handling any other ingredients or dishes.

steps.title: Decide upon what seasonings you would like to use.
steps.content: Decide upon what seasonings you would like to use. Roast chicken is versatile, and it can be flavored according to the regional aromatics, fruits and vegetables you prefer. Try lemon pepper or lemon garlic chicken. Lemon, onions and garlic are the staples of the aromatics that help to flavor the whole chicken. Pepper or garlic can be used to season the surface of the chicken as well as the inside cavity. Consider herb seasonings, such as a combination of rosemary, sage and thyme. You can use a generic poultry seasoning or Italian seasoning if you do not have access to fresh herbs. [4] X Expert Source Ollie George Cigliano Private Chef & Food Educator Expert Interview. 30 August 2021. Spanish or Mexican flavors, such as chili pepper, paprika, garlic or cayenne will make the chicken's surface spicy. Use the pre-seasoned extra meat for tacos and enchiladas. Adobo seasoning is a combination of paprika, oregano, garlic and pepper that comes pre-packaged at specialty stores and supermarkets.

steps.title: Slice your aromatics.
steps.content: Slice your aromatics. Slice 1 to 2 lemons in half to place inside the chicken cavity. Cut up onions or shallots into quarters. Peel garlic cloves. You will want to place anywhere from 2 to 10 garlic cloves, depending upon preference.

steps.title: Mix your chicken rub.
steps.content: Mix your chicken rub. Combine 2 tbsp. (30ml) of unsalted melted butter with 1/2 tsp. (0.9g) salt, 1/2 tsp. (0.9g) of pepper and 1/2 tsp. (0.9g) to 1 tbsp. (30g) of dried or fresh herbs. You can use a ratio of 1 to 3 with measuring dried or fresh herbs, since dried herbs are more potent. You can also substitute canola oil or olive oil for the butter. The fat will help to brown the surface of the bird.

steps.title: Rub the chicken with your butter and herbs or spices.
steps.content: Rub the chicken with your butter and herbs or spices. Place them underneath the skin on the surface of the chicken meat.

steps.title: Toss the lemons, onions and garlic with salt and pepper.
steps.content: Toss the lemons, onions and garlic with salt and pepper. Place them inside the cavity of the chicken. Make sure there aren't any ingredients falling out; however, it can be tightly packed. [5] X Expert Source Ollie George Cigliano Private Chef & Food Educator Expert Interview. 30 August 2021.

steps.title: Place the chicken on the roasting rack, if you have not done so already.
steps.content: Place the chicken on the roasting rack, if you have not done so already. The breasts should face upward on the rack.

steps.title: Slice apples, potatoes, onions and other vegetables into large pieces.
steps.content: Slice apples, potatoes, onions and other vegetables into large pieces. Place them below the roasting rack. If you are using a Dutch oven, place the root vegetables on the bottom of the pan, then place the chicken on top. This will help the juices drip down into the pan as they cook. If you want smaller vegetable slices, wait 20 to 30 minutes, to place them underneath the roasting rack. This will prevent overdone vegetables.

steps.title: Truss the chicken, if you choose.
steps.content: Truss the chicken, if you choose. This means you wrap the drumsticks with twine and tuck in the wings to keep the cavity closed. Trussing the chicken is not necessary. It can increase the cooking time, because the heat does not reach the dark meat as easily.

steps.title: Place the roasting pan inside the oven.
steps.content: Place the roasting pan inside the oven. Allow it to roast at 450 degrees Fahrenheit (232 degrees Celsius) for 20 minutes. This will brown the bird and seal in juices.

steps.title: Turn the oven down to 375 degrees Fahrenheit (190 degrees Celsius).
steps.content: Turn the oven down to 375 degrees Fahrenheit (190 degrees Celsius). Let it roast for 1 hour to 1 hour and 30 minutes, depending upon the size of the bird, the evenness of the oven and the altitude.

steps.title: Insert a roasting thermometer into the thigh.
steps.content: Insert a roasting thermometer into the thigh. It should read at least 170 degrees Fahrenheit (77 degrees Celsius). If it does not, allow it to roast for 20 to 30 more minutes before checking again.

steps.title: Remove the pan from the oven.
steps.content: Remove the pan from the oven. Place the chicken on an unheated surface or a cooling rack.

steps.title: Place aluminum foil over the chicken to keep the heat in.
steps.content: Place aluminum foil over the chicken to keep the heat in. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Allow it to rest with the breast up for 10 to 15 minutes.
steps.content: Allow it to rest with the breast up for 10 to 15 minutes. [7] X Expert Source Ollie George Cigliano Private Chef & Food Educator Expert Interview. 30 August 2021.

steps.title: Turn the chicken over and allow it to rest for 10 more minutes.
steps.content: Turn the chicken over and allow it to rest for 10 more minutes.

steps.title: Carve and serve.
steps.content: Carve and serve. You will need to return to the bird to take the rest of the meat off the bones for use in future recipes. Throw away the chicken carcass or place it in a pot to make homemade chicken stock.

steps.title: Finished.
steps.content: Finished.
